alert.note: Alert for Bland; Smyth; Tazewell; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 6:26PM EDT until May 06 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .Several reports of flooding in the Marion and Saltville areas have been received during the past 30 minutes or so as heavy rain and thunderstorms continue to move through this area. Interstate 81 between mile markers 35 and 70 are particularly subject to flooding during the next hour or so. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Bland, Smyth, Tazewell and Wythe. Interstate 81 between mile markers 35 and 70. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Significant reduction in visibilities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 624 PM EDT, the public reported heavy rain in Central Smyth and Wythe counties. due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in Central Smyth and Wythe counties. - Central Smyth and Wythe counties. is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Cove Creek, Cold Run, Brown Lick Branch, Buddle Branch, Blue Spring Creek, Crab Orchard Creek, Comers Creek, Cedar Run, Campbell Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wytheville... Bland... Marion... Chilhowie... Rural Retreat... Ceres... Speedwell... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
